Note

Click here to download the full example code

Eggbox (2D)¶

Initialize training function¶

from alabi.core import SurrogateModel
from alabi.benchmarks import eggbox
import alabi.visualization as vis

kernel = "ExpSquaredKernel"
benchmark = "eggbox"

vis.plot_true_fit_2D(eval(benchmark)["fn"], eval(benchmark)["bounds"],
                     savedir=f"results/{benchmark}")

results/eggbox/true_function_2D.png

Initialize GP surrogate model¶

sm = SurrogateModel(fn=eval(benchmark)["fn"],
                    bounds=eval(benchmark)["bounds"],
                    savedir=f"results/{benchmark}/{kernel}")

Train GP surrogate model¶

sm.init_samples(ntrain=200, ntest=200)
sm.init_gp(kernel=kernel, fit_amp=True, fit_mean=True, white_noise=None)
sm.active_train(niter=200, algorithm="bape", gp_opt_freq=20)

Plot GP diagnostics¶

sm.plot(plots=["gp_error", "gp_hyperparam", "gp_timing", "gp_fit_2D"])

results/eggbox/ExpSquaredKernel/gp_error_vs_iteration.png

results/eggbox/ExpSquaredKernel/gp_hyperparameters_vs_iteration.png

results/eggbox/ExpSquaredKernel/gp_train_time_vs_iteration.png

results/eggbox/ExpSquaredKernel/gp_fit_2D.png

Run MCMC using emcee¶

Error

While you can attempt to run emcee on this surrogate model using sm.run_emcee(), you’re likely to find that it won’t converge due to emcee’s affine-invariant sampling algorithm failing to explore the multimodal parameter space.

Run MCMC using dynesty¶

sm.run_dynesty()
sm.plot(plots=["dynesty_all"])

results/eggbox/ExpSquaredKernel/dynesty_posterior_kde.png

Total running time of the script: ( 0 minutes 0.000 seconds)

Download Python source code: run_eggbox.py

Download Jupyter notebook: run_eggbox.ipynb
